p: Cumulative release of NO 3 − from slow release fertilizer at different concentrations during the time is shown in Fig. 2. Passing the time up to 200 h resulted in an increasing release of NO 3 − from slow release fertilizer. Increasing the NO 3 − concentration leads to increase of release rate over time. The highest (130 mM) amount of NO 3 − released was observed in 150 mM slow release fertilizer (Fig. 2). However, NO 3 − from the urea chemical fertilizer showed a maximum release (125 mM) within 1 to 2 h (data not shown).
